ai-patthana16.65:0.2_0: Having given the immaculateness of the Dhamma
ai-patthana16.65:0.3_0: for one who is attached to the object of clinging, and so on,
ai-patthana16.65:1.1_0: Without longing for support, resistance do not give rise to the repulsion of the mind, this is a condition for the sake of sustained thought.
ai-patthana16.65:1.1_1: Without longing for support, resistance do not give rise to the repulsion of the impediments. ...
ai-patthana16.65:1.1_2: Such things don’t give rise to the repulsion of the mind. They don’t give rise to the dependent on repulsion. Because of this.
ai-patthana16.65:2.1_0: Without repulsion of the teaching, not without impingement. For this is a condition for the support, not with no support.
ai-patthana16.65:2.1_2: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
